intro: Thelesperma nuecense, commonly known as the plains prickly pear, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spine-tipped stems and showy yellow or orange flowers. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to harsh desert conditions. Its leaves are reduced to spines, and it produces edible fruits that are often used in traditional practices. Thelesperma nuecense plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various desert wildlife.
